line: His wrath, like Jove's, could bear with no controul,

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: His words bespoke the mischief in his soul;

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: To fight was not this general's only trade,

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: He shined in writing, and his wit displayed--

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: To awe the more with titles of command

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: He told of forts he ruled in Scottish land;--

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: Queen's colonel as he was, he did not know

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: That thorns and thistles, mixed with honours, grow;

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: In Britain's senate, though he held a place,

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: All did not save him from one long disgrace,

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: One stroke of fortune that convinced them all

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: That men could conquer, and lieutenants fall.

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: Foe to the rights of man, proud plunderer, say

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: Had conquest crowned you on that mighty day

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: When you, to Gates, with sorrow, rage, and shame

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: Resigned your conquests, honours, arms, and fame,

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: When at his feet Britannia's wreathes you threw,

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: And the sun sickened at a sight so new;

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: Had you been victor--what a waste of woe!

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: What souls had vanished to where souls do go!

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: What dire distress had marked your fatal way,

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: What deaths on deaths disgraced that dismal day!

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: Can laurels flourish in a soil of blood,

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: Or on those laurels can fair honours bud--

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: Cursed be that wretch who murder makes his trade,

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: Cursed be all wars that e'er ambition made!

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: What murdering Tory now relieves your grief,

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: Or plans new conquests for his favourite chief;

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: Designs still dark employ that ruffian race,

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: Beasts of your choosing, and our own disgrace,

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: So vile a crew the world ne'er saw before,

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: And grant, ye pitying heavens, it may no more:

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: If ghosts from hell infest our poisoned air,

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: Those ghosts have entered their base bodies here;

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: Murder and blood is still their dear delight--

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: Scream round their roofs, ye ravens of the night!

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: Whene'er they wed, may demons and despair,

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: And grief and woe, and blackest night be there;

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: Fiends leagued from hell the nuptial lamp display,

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: Swift to perdition light them on their way,

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: Round the wide world their devilish squadrons chace,

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: To find no realm, that grants one resting place.

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: Far to the north, on Scotland's utmost end

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: An isle there lies, the haunt of every fiend,

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: No shepherds there attend their bleating flocks,

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: But withered witches rove among the rocks;

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: Shrouded in ice, the blasted mountains show

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: Their cloven heads, to daunt the seas below;

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: The lamp of heaven in his diurnal race

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: There scarcely deigns to unveil his radiant face,

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: Or if one day he circling treads the sky

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: He views this island with an angry eye,

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: Or ambient fogs their broad, moist wings expand,

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: Damp his bright ray, and cloud the infernal land;

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: The blackening winds incessant storms prolong,

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: Dull as their night, and dreary as my song;

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: When stormy winds and gales refuse to blow,

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: Then from the dark sky drives the unpitying snow;

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: When drifting snows from iron clouds forbear,

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: Then down the hail-stones rattle through the air--

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: There screeching owls, and screaming vultures rest,

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: And not a tree adorns its barren breast;

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: No peace, no rest, the elements bestow,

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: But seas forever rage, and storms forever blow.

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: There, Loyals, there, with loyal hearts retire,

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: There pitch your tents, and kindle there your fire;

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: There desert Nature will her stings display,

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: And fiercest hunger on your vitals prey,

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: And with yourselves let John Burgoyne retire

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: To reign the monarch, whom your hearts admire.

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: Britain, at last to arrest your lawless hand,

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: Rises the genius of a generous land,

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: Our injured rights bright Gallia's prince defends,

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: And from this hour that prince and we are friends;

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: Feuds, long upheld, are vanished from our view.

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: Once we were foes--but for the sake of you--

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: Britain, aspiring Briton, now must bend--

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: Can she at once with France and us contend,

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: When we alone, remote from foreign aid,

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: Her armies captured, and distressed her trade?

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: Britain and we no more in combat join,

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: No more, as once, in every sea combine;

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: Dead is that friendship which did mutual burn,

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: Fled is the sceptre, never to return;

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: By sea and land, perpetual foes we meet,

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: Our cause more honest, and our hearts as great;

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: Lost are these regions to Britannia's reign,

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: Nor need these strangers of their loss complain,[162]

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: Since all, that here with greedy eyes they view,

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: From our own toil to wealth and empire grew.

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: Our hearts are ravished from our former queen

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: Far as the ocean God hath placed between,

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: They strive in vain to join this mighty mass

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: Torn by convulsions from its native place.

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: As well might men to flaming Hecla join

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: The huge high Alps, or towering Appenine:

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: In vain they send their half-commissioned tribe,

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: And whom they cannot conquer, strive to bribe;

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: Their pride and madness burst our union chain,

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: Nor shall the unwieldy mass unite again.

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: Nor think that France sustains our cause alone;

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: With gratitude her helping hand we own,

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: But hear, ye nations--Truth herself can say

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: We bore the heat and danger of the day:

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: She calmly viewed the tumult from afar,

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: We braved each insult, and sustained the war:

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: Oft drove the foe, or forced their hosts to yield,

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: Or left them more than once a dear bought field--

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: 'Twas then, at last, on Jersey plains distrest,

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: We swore to seek the mountains of the west,

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: There a free empire for our seed obtain,

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: A terror to the slaves that might remain.[163]

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: Peace you demand, and vainly wish to find

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: Old leagues renewed, and strength  once  more combined--

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: Yet shall not all your base dissembling art

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: Deceive the tortures of a bleeding heart--

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: Yet shall not all your mingled prayers that rise

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: Wash out your crimes, or bribe the avenging skies;

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: Full many a corpse lies mouldering on the plain

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: That ne'er shall see its little brood again:

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: See, yonder lies, all breathless, cold, and pale,

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: Drenched in her gore, Lavinia of the vale;[C]

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: The cruel Indian seized her life away,

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: As the next morn began her bridal day!--

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: This deed alone our just revenge would claim,

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: Did not ten thousand more your sons defame.

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: Returned, a captive, to my native shore,

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: How changed I find those scenes that pleased before!

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: How changed those groves where fancy loved to stray,

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: When spring's young blossoms bloom'd along the way;

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: From every eye distils the frequent tear,

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: From every mouth some doleful tale I hear!

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: Some mourn a father, brother, husband, friend:

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: Some mourn, imprisoned in their native land,

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: In sickly ships what numerous hosts confin'd

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: At once their lives and liberties resigned:

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: In dreary dungeons woeful scenes have passed,

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: Long in the historian's page the tale will last,

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: As long as spring renews the flowery wood,

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: As long as breezes curl the yielding flood!--

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: Some sent to India's sickly climes afar,

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: To dig, with slaves, for buried diamonds there,

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: There left to sicken in a land of woe

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: Where o'er scorched hills infernal breezes blow,

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: Whose every blast some dire contagion brings,

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: Fevers or death on its destructive wings,

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: 'Till fate relenting, its last arrows drew,

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: Brought death to them, and infamy to you.

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: Pests of mankind! remembrance shall recall

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: And paint these horrors to the view of all;

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: Heaven has not turned to its own works a foe

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: Nor left to monsters these fair realms below,

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: Else had your arms more wasteful vengeance spread,

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: And these gay plains been dyed a deeper red.

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: O'er Britain's isle a thousand woes impend,

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: Too weak to conquer, govern, or defend,

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: To liberty she holds pretended claim--

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: The substance we enjoy, and they the name;

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: Her prince, surrounded by a host of slaves,

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: Still claims dominion o'er the vagrant waves:

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: Such be his claims o'er all the world beside,--

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: An empty nothing--madness, rage and pride.

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: From Europe's realms fair freedom has retired,

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: And even in Britain has the spark expired--

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: Sigh for the change your haughty empire feels,

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: Sigh for the doom that no disguise conceals!

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: Freedom no more shall Albion's cliffs survey;

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: Corruption there has centered all her sway,

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: Freedom disdains her honest head to rear,

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: Or herd with nobles, kings, or princes there;[164]

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: She shuns their gilded spires and domes of state,

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: Resolved, O Virtue, at thy shrine to wait;

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: 'Midst savage woods and wilds she dares to stray,

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: And bids uncultured nature bloom more gay.

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: She is that glorious and immortal sun,

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: Without whose ray this world would be undone,

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: A mere dull chaos, sunk in deepest night,

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: An abject something, void of form and light,

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: Of reptiles, worst in rank, the dire abode,

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: Perpetual mischief, and the dragon's brood.

Poem Title: AND HER EVERLASTING DELIVERANCE FROM BRITISH TYRANNY AND OPPRESSION[161]
line: Let Turks and Russians glut their fields with blood,

line: ON AMANDA'S SINGING BIRD[165]
A native of the Canary Islands, confined in a small cage
Happy in my native grove,
I from spray to spray did rove,
Fond of music, full of love.
Dressed as fine as bird could be,
Every thing that I did see,
Every thing was mirth to me.
There had I been, happy still,
With my mate to coo and bill
In the vale, or on the hill.
But the cruel tyrant, man,
(Tyrant since the world began)
Soon abridged my little span.
How shall I the wrong forget!
Over me he threw a net;
And I am his prisoner yet.
To this rough Bermudian shore
Ocean I was hurried o'er,
Ne'er to see my country more!
To a narrow cage confined,
I, who once so gaily shined,
Sing to please the human kind.
Dear Amanda!--leave me free,
And my notes will sweeter be;
On your breast, or in the tree![166]
On your arm I would repose--
One--oh make me--of your beaus--
There I would relate my woes.
Now, all love, and full of play,
I so innocently gay,
Pine my little life away.
Thus to grieve and flutter here,
Thus to pine from year to year;
This is usage too severe.
From the chiefs who rule your isle,
I will never court a smile;
All, with them, is prison style.[167]
But from your superior mind
Let me but my freedom find,
And I will be all resigned.
Then your kiss will hold me fast--
If but once by you embraced,
In your 'kerchief I will rest.
Gentle shepherds of the plain,
Who so fondly hear my strain;
Help me to be free again.
'Tis a blessing to be free:--
Fair Amanda![168]--pity me,
Pity him who sings for thee.
But if, cruel, you deny
That your captive bird should fly,
Here detained so wrongfully,
Full of anguish, faint with woe,
I must, with my music, go
To the cypress groves below.
[165] Published in the _Freeman's Journal_, July 3, 1782, under the
title "On a Lady's Singing Bird, a native of the Canary Islands,
confined in a very small cage. Written in Bermuda, 1778."
[166] This stanza and the next original in the edition of 1809.
[167] This stanza and the two following original in the edition of 1809.

ON THE DEATH OF CAPTAIN NICHOLAS BIDDLE[170]

line: CAPTAIN JONES'S INVITATION[173]
Thou, who on some dark mountain's brow
Hast toil'd thy life away till now,
And often from that rugged steep
Beheld the vast extended deep,
Come from thy forest, and with me
Learn what it is to go to sea.
There endless plains the eye surveys
As far from land the vessel strays;
No longer hill nor dale is seen,
The realms of death intrude between,
But fear no ill; resolve, with me
To share the dangers of the sea.
But look not there for verdant fields--
Far different prospects Neptune yields;
Green seas shall only greet the eye,
Those seas encircled by the sky.
Immense and deep--come then with me
And view the wonders of the sea.
Yet sometimes groves and meadows gay
Delight the seamen on their way;
From the deep seas that round us swell
With rocks the surges to repel
Some verdant isle, by waves embrac'd,
Swells, to adorn the wat'ry waste.
Though now this vast expanse appear
With glassy surface, calm and clear;
Be not deceiv'd--'tis but a show,
For many a corpse is laid below--
Even Britain's lads--it cannot be--
They were the masters of the sea!
Now combating upon the brine,
Where ships in flaming squadrons join,
At every blast the brave expire
'Midst clouds of smoke, and streams of fire;
But scorn all fear; advance with me--
'Tis but the custom of the sea.
Now we the peaceful wave divide,
On broken surges now we ride,
Now every eye dissolves with woe
As on some lee-ward coast we go--
Half lost, half buried in the main
Hope scarcely beams on life again.
Above us storms distract the sky,
Beneath us depths unfathom'd lie,
Too near we see, a ghastly sight,[174]
The realms of everlasting night,
A wat'ry tomb of ocean green
And only one frail plank between!
But winds must cease, and storms decay,
Not always lasts the gloomy day,
Again the skies are warm and clear,
Again soft zephyrs fan the air,
Again we find the long lost shore,
The winds oppose our wish no more.
If thou hast courage to despise
The various changes of the skies,
To disregard the ocean's rage,
Unmov'd when hostile ships engage,
Come from thy forest, and with me
Learn what it is to go to sea.
[173] From the 1786 edition. In the 1795 edition the title was changed
to "The Invitation."
Captain John Paul Jones sailed from Isle de Groaix, France, on his
memorable cruise, August 14, 1779. To secure a crew for his fleet had
been the work of many months.
[174] "Disheartening sight."--_Ed. 1795._
THE SEA VOYAGE[175]
From a gay island green and fair,
With gentle blasts of southern air,
Across the deep we held our way,
Around our barque smooth waters played,
No envious clouds obscur'd the day,
Serene came on the evening shade.
Still farther to the north we drew,
And Porto Rico's mountains blue,
Were just decaying on the eye,
When from the main arose the sun;
Before his ray the shadows fly,
As we before the breezes run.
Now northward of the tropic pass'd,
The fickle skies grew black at last;
The ruffian winds began to roar,
The sea obey'd their tyrant force,
And we, alas! too far from shore,
Must now forsake our destin'd course.
The studding sails at last to hand,
The vent'rous captain gave command;
But scarcely to the task went they
When a vast billow o'er us broke,
And tore the sheets and tacks away,
Nor could the booms sustain the stroke.
Still vaster rose the angry main.
The winds through every shroud complain;
The topsails we could spread no more,
Though doubly reef'd, the furious blast
Away the fluttering canvas bore,
And vow'd destruction to the mast.
When now the northern storm was quell'd,
A calm ensued--but ocean swell'd
Beyond the towering mountain's height,
Till from the south new winds arose;
Our sails we spread at dead of night,
And fair, though fierce, the tempest blows.
When morning rose, the skies were clear
The gentle breezes warm and fair,
Convey'd us o'er the wat'ry road;
A ship o'ertook us on the way,
Her thousand sails were spread abroad,
And flutter'd in the face of day.
At length, through many a climate pass'd,
Cæsaria's hills we saw at last,
And reach'd the land of lovely dames;
My charming Cælia there I found,
'Tis she my warmest friendship claims,
The fairest maid that treads the ground.
[175] Unique in the October number of the _United States Magazine_,
1779. The poem doubtless describes the poet's voyage home from the
West Indies, in June and July, 1778.
